channel.title: Need help please
channel.description: Hi all i have dogs client v7 can i set it so wen someone logs onto my server they are useing the client :confused: :confused: Please help all u can :o

item.title: Need help please
item.dc:creator: @BurnInSilence BurnInSilence
item.description:
@BurnInSilence wrote:

someone elses tut, not mine

[code]Purpose: To learn how to force players to use your client.

Difficulty: 1/10

Assumed Knowledge: none… im here to teach you right?

Server Base: pimpscape

Classes Modified: client.java (server), signlink.java(client)

Procedure:

Step 1:

In your client’s signlink.java search for

Code:

public final void run()

under that you should see:

Code:

UID =

This tells the client what the user’s UID is when connecting to the server. Most clients just use a random number for this, but we are going to set an unchanging number. Make this as hard to guess as you can.

Step 2:
In your server’s client.java find this:

Code:

int UID = inStream.readDWord();

or something of the sort and under that add this:

Code:

		if(UID != (your uid here)) {
			System.out.println("Player is not using the (your servername) Client!");
                   		returnCode = 7;
		}

This basically is the server asking the client what its UID is, and if it is not the UID you set in the if statement, it sends a packet back to the client, and prints a message in the DOS window telling you that they have connected with the wrong client.

Step 3:

Now search for:

Code:

if(PlayerHandler.playerCount < PlayerHandler.maxPlayers

or something like that (it should be a little ways down just scroll).

It should look like this completely:

Code:

if(PlayerHandler.playerCount < PlayerHandler.maxPlayers) {
returnCode = 2;
} else if(PlayerHandler.playerCount >= PlayerHandler.maxPlayers) {
returnCode = 7;
savefile = false;
disconnected = true;
appendToLR(playerName+" failed to logon because there is too many players online.");
}

now replace that whole thing with this:

Code:

if(PlayerHandler.playerCount < PlayerHandler.maxPlayers && UID == -44232342) {
returnCode = 2;
} else if(PlayerHandler.playerCount >= PlayerHandler.maxPlayers || UID != -44232342) {
returnCode = 7;
savefile = false;
disconnected = true;
appendToLR(playerName+" failed to logon because there is too many players online.");
}

I used this because it is the most useless out of the rest, and making a new one often caused a problem that would not disconnect the player correctly, so they would be stuck online. Feel free to make your own or just add:

Code:

disconnected = true;

into the code in step two, I am just pointing out that you may have a problem with this and might have to work out a fix for it.

Anyway this code basically does the same thing as the code in step 2, however it disconnects the player.

Conclusion:
You now have put a requirement of your client to connect to the server. Using what i did on most clients will say something like “this world is full” or something like that, but you can change the:

Code:

returnCode =

to anything you want to change the message that the player will recieve but you will have to find those in your client’s client.java (im not gonna post a list sorry).[/code]

Read full topic
